author: William Shakespeare
text: I wonder how the King escaped our hands.

author: William Shakespeare
text: While we pursued the horsemen of the north,

author: William Shakespeare
text: He slyly stole away and left his men;

author: William Shakespeare
text: Whereat the great Lord of Northumberland,

author: William Shakespeare

author: William Shakespeare
text: Cheered up the drooping army; and himself,

author: William Shakespeare

author: William Shakespeare

author: William Shakespeare
text: Were by the swords of common soldiers slain.

gutenberg_title: THE THIRD PART OF KING HENRY VI
author: William Shakespeare
text: Lord Stafford’s father, Duke of Buckingham,

gutenberg_title: THE THIRD PART OF KING HENRY VI
author: William Shakespeare
text: Is either slain or wounded dangerous;

gutenberg_title: THE THIRD PART OF KING HENRY VI
author: William Shakespeare
text: I cleft his beaver with a downright blow.

gutenberg_title: THE THIRD PART OF KING HENRY VI
author: William Shakespeare
text: That this is true, father, behold his blood.

gutenberg_title: THE THIRD PART OF KING HENRY VI
author: William Shakespeare
text: [Showing his bloody sword.]

gutenberg_title: THE THIRD PART OF KING HENRY VI
author: William Shakespeare
text: And, brother, here’s the Earl of Wiltshire’s blood,

gutenberg_title: THE THIRD PART OF KING HENRY VI
author: William Shakespeare
text: [To York, showing his.]

gutenberg_title: THE THIRD PART OF KING HENRY VI
author: William Shakespeare
text: Whom I encountered as the battles joined.

gutenberg_title: THE THIRD PART OF KING HENRY VI
author: William Shakespeare
text: Speak thou for me, and tell them what I did.

gutenberg_title: THE THIRD PART OF KING HENRY VI
author: William Shakespeare
text: [Throwing down the Duke of Somerset’s head.]

gutenberg_title: THE THIRD PART OF KING HENRY VI
author: William Shakespeare
text: Richard hath best deserved of all my sons.

gutenberg_title: THE THIRD PART OF KING HENRY VI
author: William Shakespeare
text: But is your Grace dead, my Lord of Somerset?

gutenberg_title: THE THIRD PART OF KING HENRY VI
author: William Shakespeare
text: Such hope have all the line of John of Gaunt!

gutenberg_title: THE THIRD PART OF KING HENRY VI
author: William Shakespeare
text: Thus do I hope to shake King Henry’s head.

gutenberg_title: THE THIRD PART OF KING HENRY VI
author: William Shakespeare
text: And so do I. Victorious Prince of York,

gutenberg_title: THE THIRD PART OF KING HENRY VI
author: William Shakespeare
text: Before I see thee seated in that throne

gutenberg_title: THE THIRD PART OF KING HENRY VI
author: William Shakespeare
text: Which now the house of Lancaster usurps,

gutenberg_title: THE THIRD PART OF KING HENRY VI
author: William Shakespeare
text: I vow by heaven these eyes shall never close.

gutenberg_title: THE THIRD PART OF KING HENRY VI
author: William Shakespeare
text: This is the palace of the fearful king,

gutenberg_title: THE THIRD PART OF KING HENRY VI
author: William Shakespeare
text: And this the regal seat. Possess it, York,

gutenberg_title: THE THIRD PART OF KING HENRY VI
author: William Shakespeare
text: For this is thine, and not King Henry’s heirs’.

gutenberg_title: THE THIRD PART OF KING HENRY VI
author: William Shakespeare
text: Assist me, then, sweet Warwick, and I will;

gutenberg_title: THE THIRD PART OF KING HENRY VI
author: William Shakespeare
text: For hither we have broken in by force.

gutenberg_title: THE THIRD PART OF KING HENRY VI
author: William Shakespeare
text: We’ll all assist you; he that flies shall die.

gutenberg_title: THE THIRD PART OF KING HENRY VI
author: William Shakespeare
text: Thanks, gentle Norfolk. Stay by me, my lords;

gutenberg_title: THE THIRD PART OF KING HENRY VI
author: William Shakespeare
text: And, soldiers, stay and lodge by me this night.

gutenberg_title: THE THIRD PART OF KING HENRY VI
author: William Shakespeare
text: And when the King comes, offer him no violence,

gutenberg_title: THE THIRD PART OF KING HENRY VI
author: William Shakespeare
text: Unless he seek to thrust you out perforce.

gutenberg_title: THE THIRD PART OF KING HENRY VI
author: William Shakespeare
text: [They retire.]

gutenberg_title: THE THIRD PART OF KING HENRY VI
author: William Shakespeare
text: The Queen this day here holds her parliament,

gutenberg_title: THE THIRD PART OF KING HENRY VI
author: William Shakespeare
text: But little thinks we shall be of her council.

gutenberg_title: THE THIRD PART OF KING HENRY VI
author: William Shakespeare
text: By words or blows here let us win our right.

gutenberg_title: THE THIRD PART OF KING HENRY VI
author: William Shakespeare
text: Armed as we are, let’s stay within this house.

gutenberg_title: THE THIRD PART OF KING HENRY VI
author: William Shakespeare
text: The bloody parliament shall this be called,

gutenberg_title: THE THIRD PART OF KING HENRY VI
author: William Shakespeare
text: Unless Plantagenet, Duke of York, be king,

gutenberg_title: THE THIRD PART OF KING HENRY VI
author: William Shakespeare
text: And bashful Henry deposed, whose cowardice

gutenberg_title: THE THIRD PART OF KING HENRY VI
author: William Shakespeare
text: Hath made us bywords to our enemies.

gutenberg_title: THE THIRD PART OF KING HENRY VI
author: William Shakespeare
text: Then leave me not, my lords; be resolute.

gutenberg_title: THE THIRD PART OF KING HENRY VI
author: William Shakespeare
text: I mean to take possession of my right.

gutenberg_title: THE THIRD PART OF KING HENRY VI
author: William Shakespeare
text: Neither the King, nor he that loves him best,

gutenberg_title: THE THIRD PART OF KING HENRY VI
author: William Shakespeare
text: The proudest he that holds up Lancaster,

gutenberg_title: THE THIRD PART OF KING HENRY VI
author: William Shakespeare
text: Dares stir a wing if Warwick shake his bells.

gutenberg_title: THE THIRD PART OF KING HENRY VI
author: William Shakespeare
text: I’ll plant Plantagenet, root him up who dares.

gutenberg_title: THE THIRD PART OF KING HENRY VI
author: William Shakespeare
text: Resolve thee, Richard; claim the English crown.

gutenberg_title: THE THIRD PART OF KING HENRY VI
author: William Shakespeare
text: [Warwick leads York to the throne, who seats himself.]

gutenberg_title: THE THIRD PART OF KING HENRY VI
author: William Shakespeare
text: Flourish. Enter King Henry, Clifford, Northumberland, Westmoreland,

gutenberg_title: THE THIRD PART OF KING HENRY VI
author: William Shakespeare
text: Exeter and the rest, all wearing the red rose.

gutenberg_title: THE THIRD PART OF KING HENRY VI
author: William Shakespeare
text: My lords, look where the sturdy rebel sits,

gutenberg_title: THE THIRD PART OF KING HENRY VI
author: William Shakespeare
text: Even in the chair of state! Belike he means,

gutenberg_title: THE THIRD PART OF KING HENRY VI
author: William Shakespeare
text: Backed by the power of Warwick, that false peer,

gutenberg_title: THE THIRD PART OF KING HENRY VI
author: William Shakespeare
text: To aspire unto the crown and reign as king.

gutenberg_title: THE THIRD PART OF KING HENRY VI
author: William Shakespeare
text: Earl of Northumberland, he slew thy father,

gutenberg_title: THE THIRD PART OF KING HENRY VI
author: William Shakespeare
text: And thine, Lord Clifford; and you both have vowed revenge

gutenberg_title: THE THIRD PART OF KING HENRY VI
author: William Shakespeare
text: On him, his sons, his favourites, and his friends.

gutenberg_title: THE THIRD PART OF KING HENRY VI
author: William Shakespeare
text: If I be not, heavens be revenged on me!

gutenberg_title: THE THIRD PART OF KING HENRY VI
author: William Shakespeare
text: The hope thereof makes Clifford mourn in steel.

gutenberg_title: THE THIRD PART OF KING HENRY VI
author: William Shakespeare
text: What, shall we suffer this? Let’s pluck him down.

gutenberg_title: THE THIRD PART OF KING HENRY VI
author: William Shakespeare
text: My heart for anger burns. I cannot brook it.

gutenberg_title: THE THIRD PART OF KING HENRY VI
author: William Shakespeare
text: Be patient, gentle Earl of Westmoreland.

gutenberg_title: THE THIRD PART OF KING HENRY VI
author: William Shakespeare
text: Patience is for poltroons, such as he.

gutenberg_title: THE THIRD PART OF KING HENRY VI
author: William Shakespeare
text: He durst not sit there had your father lived.

gutenberg_title: THE THIRD PART OF KING HENRY VI
author: William Shakespeare
text: My gracious lord, here in the parliament

gutenberg_title: THE THIRD PART OF KING HENRY VI
author: William Shakespeare
text: Let us assail the family of York.

gutenberg_title: THE THIRD PART OF KING HENRY VI
author: William Shakespeare
text: Well hast thou spoken, cousin. Be it so.

gutenberg_title: THE THIRD PART OF KING HENRY VI
author: William Shakespeare
text: Ah, know you not the city favours them,

gutenberg_title: THE THIRD PART OF KING HENRY VI
author: William Shakespeare
text: And they have troops of soldiers at their beck?

gutenberg_title: THE THIRD PART OF KING HENRY VI
author: William Shakespeare
text: But when the Duke is slain, they’ll quickly fly.

gutenberg_title: THE THIRD PART OF KING HENRY VI
author: William Shakespeare
text: Far be the thought of this from Henry’s heart,

gutenberg_title: THE THIRD PART OF KING HENRY VI
author: William Shakespeare
text: To make a shambles of the Parliament House!

gutenberg_title: THE THIRD PART OF KING HENRY VI
author: William Shakespeare
text: Cousin of Exeter, frowns, words, and threats

gutenberg_title: THE THIRD PART OF KING HENRY VI
author: William Shakespeare
text: Shall be the war that Henry means to use.

gutenberg_title: THE THIRD PART OF KING HENRY VI
author: William Shakespeare
text: [They advance to the Duke.]

gutenberg_title: THE THIRD PART OF KING HENRY VI
author: William Shakespeare
text: Thou factious Duke of York, descend my throne,

gutenberg_title: THE THIRD PART OF KING HENRY VI
author: William Shakespeare
text: And kneel for grace and mercy at my feet;

gutenberg_title: THE THIRD PART OF KING HENRY VI
author: William Shakespeare
text: I am thy sovereign.

gutenberg_title: THE THIRD PART OF KING HENRY VI
author: William Shakespeare
text: I am thine.

gutenberg_title: THE THIRD PART OF KING HENRY VI
author: William Shakespeare
text: For shame, come down. He made thee Duke of York.

gutenberg_title: THE THIRD PART OF KING HENRY VI
author: William Shakespeare
text: ’Twas my inheritance, as the earldom was.

gutenberg_title: THE THIRD PART OF KING HENRY VI
author: William Shakespeare
text: Thy father was a traitor to the crown.

gutenberg_title: THE THIRD PART OF KING HENRY VI
author: William Shakespeare
text: Exeter, thou art a traitor to the crown

gutenberg_title: THE THIRD PART OF KING HENRY VI
author: William Shakespeare
text: In following this usurping Henry.

gutenberg_title: THE THIRD PART OF KING HENRY VI
author: William Shakespeare
text: Whom should he follow but his natural king?

gutenberg_title: THE THIRD PART OF KING HENRY VI
author: William Shakespeare
text: True, Clifford, that’s Richard, Duke of York.

gutenberg_title: THE THIRD PART OF KING HENRY VI
author: William Shakespeare
text: And shall I stand, and thou sit in my throne?

gutenberg_title: THE THIRD PART OF KING HENRY VI
author: William Shakespeare
text: It must and shall be so. Content thyself.

gutenberg_title: THE THIRD PART OF KING HENRY VI
author: William Shakespeare
text: Be Duke of Lancaster. Let him be king.

gutenberg_title: THE THIRD PART OF KING HENRY VI
author: William Shakespeare
text: He is both King and Duke of Lancaster;

gutenberg_title: THE THIRD PART OF KING HENRY VI
author: William Shakespeare
text: And that the Lord of Westmoreland shall maintain.

gutenberg_title: THE THIRD PART OF KING HENRY VI
author: William Shakespeare
text: And Warwick shall disprove it. You forget

gutenberg_title: THE THIRD PART OF KING HENRY VI
author: William Shakespeare
text: That we are those which chased you from the field

gutenberg_title: THE THIRD PART OF KING HENRY VI
author: William Shakespeare
text: And slew your fathers, and with colours spread

gutenberg_title: THE THIRD PART OF KING HENRY VI
author: William Shakespeare
text: Marched through the city to the palace gates.

gutenberg_title: THE THIRD PART OF KING HENRY VI
author: William Shakespeare
text: Yes, Warwick, I remember it to my grief;

gutenberg_title: THE THIRD PART OF KING HENRY VI
author: William Shakespeare
text: And, by his soul, thou and thy house shall rue it.

gutenberg_title: THE THIRD PART OF KING HENRY VI
author: William Shakespeare
text: Plantagenet, of thee and these thy sons,

gutenberg_title: THE THIRD PART OF KING HENRY VI
author: William Shakespeare
text: Thy kinsmen, and thy friends, I’ll have more lives

gutenberg_title: THE THIRD PART OF KING HENRY VI
author: William Shakespeare
text: Than drops of blood were in my father’s veins.

gutenberg_title: THE THIRD PART OF KING HENRY VI
author: William Shakespeare
text: Urge it no more; lest that, instead of words,

gutenberg_title: THE THIRD PART OF KING HENRY VI
author: William Shakespeare
text: I send thee, Warwick, such a messenger

gutenberg_title: THE THIRD PART OF KING HENRY VI
author: William Shakespeare
text: As shall revenge his death before I stir.

gutenberg_title: THE THIRD PART OF KING HENRY VI
author: William Shakespeare
text: Poor Clifford, how I scorn his worthless threats!

gutenberg_title: THE THIRD PART OF KING HENRY VI
author: William Shakespeare
text: Will you we show our title to the crown?

gutenberg_title: THE THIRD PART OF KING HENRY VI
author: William Shakespeare
text: If not, our swords shall plead it in the field.

gutenberg_title: THE THIRD PART OF KING HENRY VI
author: William Shakespeare
text: What title hast thou, traitor, to the crown?

gutenberg_title: THE THIRD PART OF KING HENRY VI
author: William Shakespeare
text: Thy father was, as thou art, Duke of York;

gutenberg_title: THE THIRD PART OF KING HENRY VI
author: William Shakespeare

gutenberg_title: THE THIRD PART OF KING HENRY VI
author: William Shakespeare
text: I am the son of Henry the Fifth,

gutenberg_title: THE THIRD PART OF KING HENRY VI
author: William Shakespeare
text: Who made the Dauphin and the French to stoop,

gutenberg_title: THE THIRD PART OF KING HENRY VI
author: William Shakespeare
text: And seized upon their towns and provinces.

gutenberg_title: THE THIRD PART OF KING HENRY VI
author: William Shakespeare
text: Talk not of France, sith thou hast lost it all.

gutenberg_title: THE THIRD PART OF KING HENRY VI
author: William Shakespeare
text: The Lord Protector lost it, and not I.

gutenberg_title: THE THIRD PART OF KING HENRY VI
author: William Shakespeare
text: When I was crowned I was but nine months old.

gutenberg_title: THE THIRD PART OF KING HENRY VI
author: William Shakespeare
text: You are old enough now, and yet, methinks, you lose.

gutenberg_title: THE THIRD PART OF KING HENRY VI
author: William Shakespeare
text: Father, tear the crown from the usurper’s head.

author: William Shakespeare
text: Sweet father, do so; set it on your head.

author: William Shakespeare
text: Good brother, as thou lov’st and honourest arms,

author: William Shakespeare
text: Let’s fight it out and not stand cavilling thus.

author: William Shakespeare
text: Sound drums and trumpets, and the King will fly.

author: William Shakespeare
text: Sons, peace!
